page.title: 17Eversley Football Club
page.content: Eversley has a very active football club, which was founded over a hundred years ago. There are about forty-six members whose ages range from seventeen to forty. The club runs two teams so that everyone manages to play in as many matches as possible. They need so many members to cover for injuries and unavailability. We spoke to Mr. Brian Arnold, the previous manager, who told us that his main tasks were to motivate players, supervise training sessions, pick teams and assist in the general running of the club. It costs Â£1000 a year to keep the club going, with referees, laundry bills and match fees to pay. The members hold discos and run in sponsored marathons to raise money for funds.
